allSaves.value: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

details.flavorText: These spherical inevitables are scouts and diplomats. Found throughout the multiverse, they have traditionally kept watch over on chaos and its agents. With the announcement of the Convergence, many arbiters now serve as go-betweens among the aeon alliance and its mortal associates.

senses.value: darkvision, detect alignment (chaotic only), locate inevitable

description.value: You peek into the future. Choose a particular goal, event, or activity that will occur within 1 week. You learn a cryptic clue or piece of advice that could help with the chosen event, often in the form of a rhyme or omen.

You shout a command that's hard to ignore. You can command the target to approach you, run away (as if it had the fleeing condition), release what it's holding, drop @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Prone]{Prone}, or stand in place. It can't Delay or take any reactions until it has obeyed your command. The effects depend on the target's Will save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as you command.

Critical Failure The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey your command.

Heightened You can target up to 10 creatures.

duration.value: until the end of the target's next turn

description.value:
Your eyes glow as you sense aligned auras. Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful. You detect auras of that alignment. You receive no information beyond presence or absence. You can choose not to detect creatures or effects you're aware have that alignment.

Only creatures of 6th level or higher-unless divine spellcasters, undead, or beings from the Outer Sphere-have alignment auras.

Heightened You learn each aura's location and strength.

You repair the target item. You restore 5 Hit Points per spell level to the target, potentially removing the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Broken]{Broken} condition if this repairs it past the item's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Broken]{Broken} Threshold. You can't replace lost pieces or repair an object that's been completely destroyed.

Heightened You repair the target item. You restore 5 Hit Points per spell level to the target, potentially removing the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Broken]{Broken} condition if this repairs it past the item's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Broken]{Broken} Threshold. You can't replace lost pieces or repair an object that's been completely destroyed.

Heightened You can target a non-magical object of 2 Bulk or less, or a magical object of 1 Bulk or less.

target.value: non-magical object of light Bulk or less

description.value: An arbiter can always sense the direction of the nearest non-arbiter inevitable on the plane, but it cannot sense the range of the inevitable.

The arbiter releases an electrical burst from its body that deals [[/r 3d6 # electricity damage]] electricity damage (basic Reflex save). Following such a burst, the arbiter becomes stunned for 24 hours.
